item.title: Size of random convex hulls
item.description: I recently came across a really nice way to determine the expected number of vertices of the convex hull of a point set picked uniformly at random from some convex body in $\mathbb{R}^2$. For instance, suppose we pick $n$ points uniformly at random from a unit square or unit circle. It turns out in these cases, the number of points on the convex hull is $O(\log n)$ and $O(n^{1/3})$ respectively.
